titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1548
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1548

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

1.[Now it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, … … … and … … and … … of the lineage of Maʿā-[hirum] … … the inhabitants of the two towns of Qarnā and Shaʿbum. And it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, any of their households, nor] 2.[their land, nor their palm groves, nor their properties, nor their (male) servants, nor their maidservants, nor anything which the lineage of Maʿāhirum possess or shall (in the future) possess, … …, nor their children. And it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, any of their agnates, nor their tribe of Maʿīnum, (what derives) from any of the documents and pur-] 3.[chases which Saʿdum Dhū-Maʿāhiram has authenticated or shall (in the future) authenticate, (namely) one purchase of a palm grove … … in their house of Ẓabiyyān in the town of Shaʿbum, all … … the surrounding area, or … … in that purchase … … … and the purchase which is (made) by the inhabitants and the (male) servants] 4.[of the lineage of Maʿāhirum, and the purchase and … of their households and that which they possess in the town of Qarnā and (in) Yathill and Shaʿbum, nor from any documents and purchases … … through which they might discover that Saʿdum Dhū-Maʿāhiram has authenticated, or shall (in the future) authenticate and put forward a request. (All this is) in order] 5.[that those documents and purchases and authentications and claims be null and void and dissolved and discarded and (that this ruling be) binding; and in order that (this ruling) be implemented on behalf of, and with obligations upon, the lineage of Dhū-Maʿāhiram and their children and their descendants and] 6.[their (male) servants and their maidservants and their households; and on behalf of, and with obligations upon, all of their agnates and their tribe of Maʿīnum; on behalf of, and with obligations upon, all that the lineage of Dhū-Maʿāhiram possesses and shall (in the future) possess. If ever they are challenged, let these documents and purchases and authentications and claims be validated and proclaimed publicly] 7.[on the authority of all gods and kings and queens and tribes and the Sabaeans and (the confederation of) Fayshān and their tribe of M[…]m and every descendant and every man-big and small, far and near. And this concessionary] 8.[document was (written up) in the month of Dhū-Niswar the Latter in the (eponymous) year of ʾAbīkarib bin Sumhūkarib of the lineage of Dhū-Sh… … … … And this concessionary document is the concessionary documents which Halakʾamar, son of Karibʾīl Watar Yuhanʿim, King of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, has authenticated.]

tei:ab.tei:supplied: Now it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, … … … and … … and … … of the lineage of Maʿā-hirum … … the inhabitants of the two towns of Qarnā and Shaʿbum. And it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, any of their households, nor

their land, nor their palm groves, nor their properties, nor their male servants, nor their maidservants, nor anything which the lineage of Maʿāhirum possess or shall in the future possess, … …, nor their children. And it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, any of their agnates, nor their tribe of Maʿīnum, what derives from any of the documents and pur-

chases which Saʿdum Dhū-Maʿāhiram has authenticated or shall in the future authenticate, namely one purchase of a palm grove … … in their house of Ẓabiyyān in the town of Shaʿbum, all … … the surrounding area, or … … in that purchase … … … and the purchase which is made by the inhabitants and the male servants

of the lineage of Maʿāhirum, and the purchase and … of their households and that which they possess in the town of Qarnā and in Yathill and Shaʿbum, nor from any documents and purchases … … through which they might discover that Saʿdum Dhū-Maʿāhiram has authenticated, or shall in the future authenticate and put forward a request. All this is in order

that those documents and purchases and authentications and claims be null and void and dissolved and discarded and that this ruling be binding; and in order that this ruling be implemented on behalf of, and with obligations upon, the lineage of Dhū-Maʿāhiram and their children and their descendants and

their male servants and their maidservants and their households; and on behalf of, and with obligations upon, all of their agnates and their tribe of Maʿīnum; on behalf of, and with obligations upon, all that the lineage of Dhū-Maʿāhiram possesses and shall in the future possess. If ever they are challenged, let these documents and purchases and authentications and claims be validated and proclaimed publicly

on the authority of all gods and kings and queens and tribes and the Sabaeans and the confederation of Fayshān and their tribe of M…m and every descendant and every man-big and small, far and near. And this concessionary

document was written up in the month of Dhū-Niswar the Latter in the eponymous year of ʾAbīkarib bin Sumhūkarib of the lineage of Dhū-Sh… … … … And this concessionary document is the concessionary documents which Halakʾamar, son of Karibʾīl Watar Yuhanʿim, King of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, has authenticated.

div.tei:ab:
Now it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, … … … and … … and … … of the lineage of Maʿā-hirum … … the inhabitants of the two towns of Qarnā and Shaʿbum. And it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, any of their households, nor
their land, nor their palm groves, nor their properties, nor their male servants, nor their maidservants, nor anything which the lineage of Maʿāhirum possess or shall in the future possess, … …, nor their children. And it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, any of their agnates, nor their tribe of Maʿīnum, what derives from any of the documents and pur-
chases which Saʿdum Dhū-Maʿāhiram has authenticated or shall in the future authenticate, namely one purchase of a palm grove … … in their house of Ẓabiyyān in the town of Shaʿbum, all … … the surrounding area, or … … in that purchase … … … and the purchase which is made by the inhabitants and the male servants
of the lineage of Maʿāhirum, and the purchase and … of their households and that which they possess in the town of Qarnā and in Yathill and Shaʿbum, nor from any documents and purchases … … through which they might discover that Saʿdum Dhū-Maʿāhiram has authenticated, or shall in the future authenticate and put forward a request. All this is in order
that those documents and purchases and authentications and claims be null and void and dissolved and discarded and that this ruling be binding; and in order that this ruling be implemented on behalf of, and with obligations upon, the lineage of Dhū-Maʿāhiram and their children and their descendants and
their male servants and their maidservants and their households; and on behalf of, and with obligations upon, all of their agnates and their tribe of Maʿīnum; on behalf of, and with obligations upon, all that the lineage of Dhū-Maʿāhiram possesses and shall in the future possess. If ever they are challenged, let these documents and purchases and authentications and claims be validated and proclaimed publicly
on the authority of all gods and kings and queens and tribes and the Sabaeans and the confederation of Fayshān and their tribe of M…m and every descendant and every man-big and small, far and near. And this concessionary
document was written up in the month of Dhū-Niswar the Latter in the eponymous year of ʾAbīkarib bin Sumhūkarib of the lineage of Dhū-Sh… … … … And this concessionary document is the concessionary documents which Halakʾamar, son of Karibʾīl Watar Yuhanʿim, King of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, has authenticated.

Now it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, … … … and … … and … … of the lineage of Maʿā-hirum … … the inhabitants of the two towns of Qarnā and Shaʿbum. And it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, any of their households, nor
their land, nor their palm groves, nor their properties, nor their male servants, nor their maidservants, nor anything which the lineage of Maʿāhirum possess or shall in the future possess, … …, nor their children. And it is not the responsibility of, nor incumbent upon, any of their agnates, nor their tribe of Maʿīnum, what derives from any of the documents and pur-
chases which Saʿdum Dhū-Maʿāhiram has authenticated or shall in the future authenticate, namely one purchase of a palm grove … … in their house of Ẓabiyyān in the town of Shaʿbum, all … … the surrounding area, or … … in that purchase … … … and the purchase which is made by the inhabitants and the male servants
of the lineage of Maʿāhirum, and the purchase and … of their households and that which they possess in the town of Qarnā and in Yathill and Shaʿbum, nor from any documents and purchases … … through which they might discover that Saʿdum Dhū-Maʿāhiram has authenticated, or shall in the future authenticate and put forward a request. All this is in order
that those documents and purchases and authentications and claims be null and void and dissolved and discarded and that this ruling be binding; and in order that this ruling be implemented on behalf of, and with obligations upon, the lineage of Dhū-Maʿāhiram and their children and their descendants and
their male servants and their maidservants and their households; and on behalf of, and with obligations upon, all of their agnates and their tribe of Maʿīnum; on behalf of, and with obligations upon, all that the lineage of Dhū-Maʿāhiram possesses and shall in the future possess. If ever they are challenged, let these documents and purchases and authentications and claims be validated and proclaimed publicly
on the authority of all gods and kings and queens and tribes and the Sabaeans and the confederation of Fayshān and their tribe of M…m and every descendant and every man-big and small, far and near. And this concessionary
document was written up in the month of Dhū-Niswar the Latter in the eponymous year of ʾAbīkarib bin Sumhūkarib of the lineage of Dhū-Sh… … … … And this concessionary document is the concessionary documents which Halakʾamar, son of Karibʾīl Watar Yuhanʿim, King of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, has authenticated.

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
